text:
Hello developers,

I have a Form field that i invoke using `{% form ... %}`
As HubSpot validates the emails on frontend as well, it is not accepting custom emails like this one: <mailto:username@nainboo.com|username@nainboo.com> (this is a made up email for illustration purposes only)

Any idea how to tackle this?

According to the FAQ in HubSpot, the email in my case passess all the checks

*Formatting* :white_check_mark: 
*Domain blocklist* :white_check_mark: *(not in the blocklist)*
*DNS lookup* :white_check_mark: *(The email has an MX and A record)*
*Deliverability* :white_check_mark: *(Is not globally blocked)*

<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/forms/forms-faq>

What is the recommended way to create Quotes / Estimates that have line items with editable fields?

In a quote I need to include: Source Connection, Destination Connection, Data Flow Name, Data Flow Description and Amount.

The salesperson will need to be able to specify what goes in each of these fields.

For example one line item would look like this:

*Source Connection:*
HubSpot

*Destination Connection:*
QuickBooks

*Data Flow Name:*
Create Sales Order

*Data Flow Description* 
Every time a deal closes in HubSpot, create a Sales Order in QuickBooks...

*Amount*
$2,500

I want to be able to add several line items to a Quote in the above manner.
i'm i correct that there is no way to programmatically interact with sequences?
